Systematic investigations of the effect of structural changes on potency and duration of action led to the discovery of phenobarbital at Bayer in <a8_0>1911<a8_0/> and the discovery of its potent anti-epileptic activity in 1912. Phenobarbital was among the most widely used drugs for the treatment of <b10_0>epilepsy<b10_0/> through the 1970s, and as of 2014, remains on the World Health Organizations list of essential medications.
